sources.title: Cheers of the Crowd (1935) IRENE WARE
sources.description:
Starring: Irene Ware, Harry Holman, Roberta Gale
Directed by: Vin Moore
Writer: George Waggner (Story & Screenplay)

Take a peek inside a Broadway theater, circa 1935. Thereâ€™s a Crook, a Con Man, and a carnival barker named Honest John. A lovesick Usher, a gold diggin' Hat Check Girl, and a feisty female reporter played by Irene Ware, the almost Miss Universe of 1929.

Trivia: Irene Ware was crowned Miss United States in 1929. That same year she was first runner-up for the title of Miss Universe at a pageant held in Galveston, Texas. The Miss Universe contest of the 1920s was not connected to the current Miss Universe system, which was launched in 1952.

metadata.Plot: To draw attention to a popular show, a publicity expert hires a former carnival character, not knowing that the man is on the run from the law.
metadata.Actors: Russell Hopton, Irene Ware, Harry Holman
